alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 2:08PM CST until January 19 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM MST /MIDNIGHT CST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Greeley and Wichita Counties. * WHEN...From 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ this afternoon to 11 PM MST /midnight CST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions are expected late this evening into Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation may begin as rain or a wintry mix. A short period of freezing drizzle or light freezing rain cannot be ruled out. In other words, hazardous travel conditions may exist before it begins to snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
